alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 30 at 1:03PM PST until December 31 at 1:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall in a short period of time. * WHERE...All of Orange County, The Inland Empire, the Riverside and San Bernardino County Mountains, the San Diego County Coasts, Valleys and Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 PM Saturday through 2 AM Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches will become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of heavy rain associated with an Atmospheric River will move across Southern California Saturday night. The heavy rain will move into San Bernardino and Orange Counties in the evening, and then move south across Riverside and San Diego County through midnight. The rain will taper off and end toward daybreak Sunday. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
